author: Simon Difford
description: In his The Fine Art of Mixing Drinks, David Embury says, "The Hot Spiced Rum is bad enough, but the lump of butter is the final insult. It blends with the hot rum just about as satisfactorily as warm olive oil blends with champagne!" It's rare for us to question Embury but we rather like this slightly oily, warming, spicy toddy. This drink is even better when you use heated dry cider in place of boiling water.
name: Hot Buttered Rum Cocktail
recipeIngredient: 60 ml Caribbean blended rum aged 6-10 years

recipeInstructions.text: Place bar spoon loaded with honey in warmed glass
Add other ingredients and STIR until honey and butter are dissolved
